sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The drivebase is the foundation of your robot's movement. Common FTC drivebases are tank, mecanum, and holonomic. Each has different movement capabilities and programming requirements.

sections.title: Tank Drive
sections.content: Tank drive uses two sets of wheels (left and right), each controlled by one joystick. Forward/backward when both sticks move the same direction; turning when they move opposite directions. Simple, reliable, and easy to program.

sections.title: Tank Drive Control
sections.content: Each joystick controls one side of the robot.

sections.title: Mecanum Drive
sections.content: Mecanum drive uses four special wheels that allow strafing (moving left/right without turning). Requires four motors and different math for wheel powers. High maneuverability for driver-controlled play.

sections.title: Mecanum Drive Control
sections.content: Y for forward/back, X for strafe, right stick X for rotation.

sections.title: Holonomic (Omni) Drive
sections.content: Holonomic drivebases use omni wheels in an X or triangle pattern. Like mecanum, they allow omnidirectional movement. The math for wheel powers differs from mecanum based on wheel arrangement.

sections.title: Comparison
content: Mecanum: Omnidirectional, can strafe, more complex hardware and code.
Holonomic: Omnidirectional, different wheel layout, less common in FTC.
